name: jgitver
body:
### Welcome to JGitver.
JGitver is community hosting several projects whose goal is to let developers, devops and other project maintainers to industrialize the way they handle their project versioning.

Please visit each jgitver component page in order to have some details on each.


### jgitver library
The library responsible for version calculation ; based on [jgit](https://eclipse.org/jgit/) it uses git metadatas, tags & history to produce a set of data including a calculated project version.  
Standard users will normally use the library via one of its build plugin:

- [jgitver maven plugin](#jgitver-maven-plugin)
- [gradle jgitver plugin](#gradle-jgitver-plugin)

### jgitver maven plugin

maven core extension allowing to define maven POM version using jgitver.  
Visit the github project page for details: [jgitver-maven-plugin](https://github.com/jgitver/jgitver-maven-plugin) 

### jgitver gradle plugin

gradle plugin allowing to define build.gradle version using jgitver.  
Visit the github project page for details: [gradle-jgitver-plugin](https://github.com/jgitver/gradle-jgitver-plugin) 

### Authors and Contributors
JGitver has been created and is maintained by Matthieu Brouillard (@McFoggy).  
Each jgitver project received feedback & contributions by several people, many thanks to them.  
Visit each project github home to find a CONTRIBUTORS file for each.

### Support or Contact
JGitver and its associated plugins is an open source effort. Do not hesitate to fill issues and to contribute via PR.  
In case you need specific support or specific developments, you can still reach [contact me](mailto://matthieu@brouillard.fr)
